intro: Chamaecrista chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí burr legume, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces distinctive, spiny pods that contain seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in dry forests and savannas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological and medicinal research.
